Articles.Content:
Hidey ho, people!

Earlier this year, I started the thread 'Quest for Lightspeed!' which begin with me building a probe with many powerful thrusters, and the console allowing for infinite fuel.

I was very close to achieving c when I had to leave the forum for a family vacation. Upon returning, I still couldn't get right back on it as there were other things beyond my control (such as a flooded house...). I can't seem to find the original thread, but many people were anticipating to see how it ended. So now without further ado, I give you the LOLHAX 2 defying everything we know of how the universe works:

I also saved a few clips of the craft in 10-minute lengths (demo version of Bandicam), not sure if I'll ever put that together, though...

If I recall correctly, the alloted real-time it took for the craft to accelerate is approximately 3 months. Plus or minus 3 weeks.

Enjoy!
*sigh* Well...I guess it's out there for anyone who was still there when I first posted this
Proves the universe and scott manley wrong
Nice job I've been waiting for the conclusion to this for months!

Hi! Yes I remember your quest. . Welcome back!

excellent!
I remember this! Have you found any new solar systems yet?

What kind of TWR for this?

TWR? I don't understand.

Nice job I've been waiting for the conclusion to this for months!

Hooray, someone remembers!

I remember this! Have you found any new solar systems yet?

Nope, but the kraken and I are poker buddies now.
Unfortunately, I cannot seem to upgrade my save...I'll keep it somewhere safe, though. Thank you for your service, LOLHAX 2.
